title: First of its kind statistics on pregnant women in US prisons

title_detail.value: First of its kind statistics on pregnant women in US prisons

summary: In what is believed to be a first-of-its-kind systematic look at pregnancy frequency and outcomes among imprisoned US women, researchers say almost 1,400 pregnant women were admitted to 22 US state and all federal prisons in a recent year. They also found that most of the prison pregnancies -- over 90 percent -- ended in live births with no maternal deaths.
